page.title: 14THE GORDON SCHOOLS
page.content: Gordon Schools were built in memory of Elizabeth Brodies husband "The Duke of Gordon" from which it gets its name,Huntly Gordon Schools. Huntly school has been open to people from 1839. It started off as the Simpson building which is now used for music, drama and home economics. Then around 70 years later a large school was built so more subjects could be taught. Most people start school at the age of 5 and stay in primary for 7 years then at the age of 12 or 13 they go to the secondary. In the secondary the years go from 1st to 6th.There are roughly 1200 people in the secondary and the special unit.There are 21 classes with roughly 35 in each,in the secondary.
